messageValues.message: =You are a professional translator. Translate the paragraph between <<< and >>> into natural, fluent English. Keep numbers, special characters and placeholders exactly as in the original. Return only the translated paragraph, with no explanations or comments.

parameters.content:
## Decompression

1. The uploaded .docx is renamed to .zip so it can be decompressed.

2. The .zip is decompressed into the core .xml files of the .docx (if unclear, look up the .docx file structure).

## Translation

1. Split the document into paragraphs and send only these paragraphs to the LLM.

2. The LLM translates each paragraph.

3. The translated paragraphs are combined again using their index numbers so the document.xml can be rebuilt.

## Segmentation

1. Extract the raw content of document.xml (the main text file in a .docx; the rest is mostly layout and metadata).

2. Filter out the text parts and group them into paragraphs. Each text part gets an index so it can later be replaced with the matching translation.

## Submission

Entry point where the user uploads a .docx file via form.

## Rebuilding

1. Adjust all items with translations and index numbers into the format expected by the rebuild step.

2. Rebuild the document.xml file with the translated text inserted at the correct positions.

## Compression

1. Prepare the correct folder structure for compression.

2. Compress all .xml files back into a translated .docx file.

## Preparation

1. Collect all .xml files contained in the original .docx.

2. Replace the old document.xml with the newly generated, translated version.
